/work/doc/pages/SessionVersionIdentification.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 \defgroup session-version-identification Session Version Identification (sessionVerId)
2 \ingroup fixp-protocol-session
3 
4 \details
5 
6 Each FIXP session is represented with a unique 64-bit identifier (the `sessionVerId` field).
7 Its value must be incremented each time the `Negotiate` message is sent to the gateway.
8 
9 The OnixS::B3::BOE::Session automatically generates the `sessionVerId` in the following cases:
10 
11 - A new OnixS::B3::BOE::Session object is created, and the value from the previous run cannot be restored from
12 \ref selecting-session-storage "the session storage".
13 - The OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::reset method is called.
14 
15 One can pass a `sessionVerId` value manually to the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::Session constructor.
16 
17 To read the `sessionVerId` value, use the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::sessionVerId() const method.
18 
19 For example:
20 
21 \snippet Session.cpp sessionVerId
22 
23 \section re-setting-sessionVerId Re-setting sessionVerId
24 
25 To reset the `sessionVerId` intra-session on the same trading day,
26 use the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::reset() method.
27 
28 \note The OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::reset method can be called only when the session is disconnected.
29 
30 \see \ref restoring-session-state
31 \see \ref scheduler
